Description: Terracotta figurine fragment: right foot, broken at top, hollow, wearing sandal, with broad strap across arch. Orange-red porous clay with white surface or slip.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Compare a similar foot in Philadelphia from Naukratis, E35. 4th century BC (?) parallel in the Louvre, possibly from Marion, Cyprus (Fourrier & Queyrel 1998, 471-2, no.719 = MNB 763a MNB 763b). Egypt Exploration Fund distribution list Philadelphia no. 35. Caubet, A., Queyrel, A. & Fourrier, S. 1998. 'L'art Des Modeleurs D'argile: Antiquités De Chypre, Coroplastique'. Musée du Louvre'. Paris.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.112) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5842 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
